ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Druids relative to Necros
ygData.msgSnippet: You need to remember Necro has the best pet in the game and they are also the best solo class. They are designed to solo and even though druids are to, I
ygData.messageBody:
You need to remember Necro has the best pet in the
game and they are also the best solo class.

They are designed to solo and even though druids are
to, I really think Druids are better in groups

also Necro's can Life tap.

It does not surpise me that a Necro 3 levels lower can
out solo you.

here is an example. I had a level 18 mage and my
friend was level 20 druid. I can solo yellow Crag
Spiders in EK and his druid has trouble. The water
pet is better against poisons and the pets can take
the beating while I cast DD's.

SO I think this is what you are experiencing.

Hope this helps

Rob

--- mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@...> wrote:
> I have been camping the brutes in Warsliks Woods.
> Only once have I
> had to wait for the camp. That time I was following
> a Necro, lvl 30.
> Watched his kills. Much faster than mine. Curious as
> to whether this
> is normal.
>
> Perhaps my technique is flakey. I ensnare,
> ensnarring root, dot, dot,
> and med. Have to often refresh the root at least
> once. Then refresh
> one dot. Dead brute. Not too fast, but affective.
> This is on dark
> blue brutes with me at lvl 33.
>
> If it goes well I come out down only one bubble of
> mana. Usually at
> least half. Only twice did I get low, and then I
> just burned the rest
> on nukes to finish the kill. Didn't want to waste
> mana on roots that
> weren't holding.
>
> I am working as a pure caster now, and this is my
> highest level
> character. I am unfamiliar with hybrids, but
> watching a lower level
> necro outpace my kills made me wonder if I could not
> do better.
>
> Any thoughts?
>
> Barto Proudfoot
>
>
